intro: Pleuropterus zuccarinii, commonly known as the Zuccarini's pleuropterus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
